title: Simple etiquette.
body:
There are some un-sopken rules in this game that you are not bound by law to follow, but its generally considered polite to adhere to them.

For example: 
leashing the jungler.
Not KSing a kill that you had no part in.
Honouring the lane calling system.
Not banning champions that your team wants to pick.
Pinging minion waves.

the list goes on and on

but one thing in particular I would like to talk about: Claiming jungle camps.
Unlike Lane minions, usually when someone has started attacking a jungle camp, most people will leave the monsters alone, and let the person take the camp. 

If your Lee Sin is attacking raptors, and you are Xerath, you don't just fire Q into the raptor camp and steal all the gold. It just isn't done.
People respect the jungler _(or whoever is taking the camps)_ and leave that camp alone once someone starts attacking it. _(i don't know why this applies to jungle monsters but not to lane minions, but thats just the way it is.)_

So what I want to know, is why 90% of the community doesn't show Ivern the same etiquette?
Many times i have actually been mid-cast starting a grove on wolves or raptors or something _(like i am actually standing at the camp, performing the spell)_, and a Yasuo or Jinx or whatever will just walk up take the whole camp and leave, not even leaving me the big one.

Or theres an obviously finished grove that i am walking to, and a Renekton or Zed will just take it on their way past.

Like seriously? 

Im not having a go at anyone _(although it is bloody annoying sometimes)_ I am just genuinely interested as to why most people will follow this simple etiquette where other champions are concerned, but for some reason throw all manners out the window when theres an Ivern.

Its just so weird. 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
